t: That*p which came as the word of the Lord*s to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh conquered Gaza.

Thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn waters are going to rise from the north And*ln become an overflowing torrent, And*ln overflow the land and all its fullness, The*ln city and those who live in it; And*ln the men will cry out, And*ln every inhabitant of the land will wail.

Because*ln of the noise of the galloping hoofs of his stallions, The*ln tumult of his chariots, and*i the rumbling of his wheels, The*ln fathers have not turned back for their*i children, Because*ln of the limpness of their*i hands,

On*ln account of the day that is coming To*ln destroy all the Philistines, To*ln cut off from Tyre and Sidon Every*ln ally that is left; For*ln the Lord*s is going to destroy the Philistines, The*ln remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.
Baldness*ln has come upon Gaza; Ashkelon*ln has been ruined. O*ln remnant of their valley, How*ln long will you gash yourself?
Ah,*ln sword of the Lord,*s How*ln long will you not be quiet? Withdraw*ln into your sheath; Be*ln at rest and stay still.
How*ln can it be quiet, When*ln the Lord*s has given it an order? Against*ln Ashkelon and against the seacoast— There*ln He has assigned it.”
